holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year’s Day is the first day of the year, or January 1, in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.description: Berchtold Day is a public holiday in a number of Switzerland's cantons.

holidays.name: Epiphany
holidays.description: Epiphany is a Christian holiday celebrated globally on January 6 each year. It commemorates two events recorded in the Bible: the three wise men’s visit to baby Jesus; and Jesus’ baptism.

holidays.description: Carnival Thursday is a half day holiday in Switzerland

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: February 14 is Valentine's Day or Saint Valentine's Feast. The day of love owes its origins to ancient Roman and European Christian traditions.

holidays.description: Ascension Day is the 40th day of Easter. It is a religious holiday that commemorates the ascension of Jesus Christ into heaven.

holidays.name: Pentecost
holidays.description: Many Christians all over the world annually observe Pentecost, also known as Whitsunday or Whit Sunday.
